column4: I'd have it all squared away if hotplug, etc, didn't notice the i810 driver onboard.. I've though about removing it from the kernel. But damn I'm lazy and am hoping for a work around.
Hmmmn, that would work perfectly, I'd gather.
Well, I can go into CLI with the ati I can't start the xserver.
If I had an xorgconfig that would do, as I could specify which driver for the xserver to use.
Or if I knew the proper crap to change I could edit xorg.conf manually, but I don't know the names.
Does anyone remember the old xf86config and Xorgconfig? Does ubuntu have any equivalent?
Something that walks you through generating an xorg.conf file?
I am trying to get my ati radeon working with xorg.
And I have an onboard i810 that gets in the way of the autmagic conf generatin.
